title: The Immense, Eternal Footprint Humanity Leaves on Earth: Plastics

readable_content: - NYT article excerpt (2023-12-08): Scientists estimate that between 5 million and 13 million metric tons of plastic are put into the ocean each year. From the 1950s to today, 8.3 billion metric tons of plastic have been produced, with around half of it made since 2004. Plastic does not naturally degrade, posing a significant environmental concern. A study in Science Advances provides the first comprehensive analysis of mass-produced plastics, highlighting the scale and impact of plastic production on the environment.
summary: The article highlights the staggering amount of plastic that is being put into the ocean each year, emphasizing the significant environmental concern posed by the production and disposal of plastic. The information prompts us to reconsider the use of plastic and to take action to address this pressing issue. Sentiment: 1.0
